section.title: Introduction
section.para: The Search & Relate tags are an addition to the MMBase taglib, and add more sophisticated functionality mainly target at interaction with users who want to create relations between MMBase nodes
The creation of simple form based editors is quite simple
So there is no need for some extra servlet receiving the post. The JSP itself can handle everthing.

MMBase-taglib does not however provide a way to add simple 'relation' editors to this formalism. It can be made, but it is not simple, and needs a lot of customized code. This 'Search & Relate Component fixes that.

section.title: Installation
section.para: Search & Relate is distributed as a 'war overlay'. Installation only requires overlaying this war. The only prequisites is the 'base' mmbase war, i.e. mmbase and mmbase taglib, and the templates of /mmbase which belong to those.
After Installation this documentation and examples can be found in the MMBase admin pages /mmbase/admin

section.title: AJAX & JQuery
section.para: In contradiction to the tags of the mmbase taglib, which are all completely self contained, most, if not all, the functionality of the tags of this application heavily depends on AJAX calls. This means that a bunch of server side JSP servlets and javascript libraries (based on JQuery and JQuery-UI) are needed. Those can be found in the /mmbase/searchrelate directory.

section.title: List
section.para: The javascript associated with mm-sr:relatednodes can be found in /mmbase/searchrelate/List.js.jsp, and the jsps associated with that, are found in /mmbase/searchrelate/list/.

section.title: mm-sr:search
section.para: mm-sr:search is actually just a simplified version of mm-sr:relate (it only shows the 'search' part).

section.title: Javascript
section.para: The javascript associated with mm-sr:relate can be found in /mmbase/searchrelate/Searcher.js.jsp, and the jsps associated with that, are found in /mmbase/searchrelate/.
